channel.title: AI - Category - Chandra Kundu | PhD Candidate at UCF
channel.description: Chandra Kundu is a Ph.D. candidate in Big Data Analytics at the University of Central Florida, focusing on Robust PCA, Matrix Completion, and Deep Unfolding.

item.title: How to Generate Images Locally Using Open Source AI Models
item.description:
Generating images locally using open-source AI models is a fascinating way to leverage AI’s creative potential. Among the available tools, Invoke AI stands out due to its ease of installation and robust features. While Automatic1111 is popular, Invoke AI offers a more streamlined experience for beginners and advanced users alike. Here’s a guide to help you set up and run Invoke AI on your local Windows computer.

Prerequisites

Before diving into the installation process, ensure you have the following:

item.title: How to create a chatbot like ChatGPT by running LLM locally in Windows via Ollama and Open WebUI
item.description:
In this post we will see that how to create a chatbot like ChatGPT by running Large Language Model (LLM) locally in Windows via Ollama and Open WebUI

Creating a chatbot that runs a large language model (LLM) on your local machine can be done in several ways. Here are some methods you might consider:

  • Using API and Programming: This approach is often difficult and time-consuming.
  • Chatbot UI: This method requires API access from OpenAI. It’s very good if you want to use it remotely, but as of my knowledge, it may not support local model access.
  • Ollama and Open WebUI: These can be used with APIs from OpenAI and locally stored, trained LLM models.

In this post, I will discuss how we can use Ollama and Open WebUI.
